column2: Webinar ID
Question
Can he please slow down.  It's hard to follow him
How do qualitytive aspects are reflected in the model, e.g. where regulations massively favor e.g. Big Players and are almost impossible to meet by small or medium sized businesses?
How do you characterize regulatory stance at different governmental levels if those are more or less permissive than one another?
Could the tobacco industry alter these codes to misrepresent sales data?

EVALI: Has the (far too) late "revelation" of the true cause (Vit. E-Acetate, NOT nicotine vaping, NOT flavors) of EVALI have any influence on restrictive regluations that used EVALI as a pretext for justification?

How strong is bas are the sales data when the nielssen rating only encompas the sales vanues that are used mainly by big tobacco companies and their direct competition (disposable / non-refillable pods) while most open systems are mostly sold via untracked venues like specialist shops and online?

If a regulator adopts safety rules for new products, presumably that would tend to reduce sales in the short term (because some brands would disappear) but might increase sales in the long term (because potential consumers would be reassured on safety). How do you count such things in your framework?

What % of the total e-cig mkt is accounted for by vape shops relative to gas & convenience stores? In Canada G & C stores have 30% I wonder if there is any reason that sales in vape shops might have been impacted differently by EVALI?

Where are open systems in your "Example Application"?
I can only see "Pod-Mod" and "disposable".
Ignored because of seeming insignificance in the Nielssen numbers?
Would be interesting to add in non-cigarette tobacco product sales in this mix.

Does menthol cig use in Poland vary systematically with demographics, e.g. men/women, rural/urban, or maybe some ethnicity? I ask because in the US the menthol market share is so much larger for African-American smokers.
What would the effect of the menthol ban been had prices not dropped?

Building on Don's question, are menthol cigarettes used more or less frequently among young people in Poland? Does Poland survey their youth for tobacco use? Is there a way to see if youth initiation has declined?
column5: Building on Don's question, are menthol cigarettes used more or less frequently among young people in Poland? Does Poland survey their youth for tobacco use? Is there a way to see if youth initiation has declined?

column2: how do we access this data?
column5: You’d need to purchase directly from Nielsen

column2: Alex, Great talk but how much was the menthol ban anticipated to have a short term effect? Is the anticipated effect not longer term, specifically on youth uptake and that would take much longer to show.

Great presentation Alex!  Do you think that one of the challenges with sales data is that they may mask differences across subgroups in the effects of the policies?  And are there ways to get around this?

I agree that sales data are great! But for the record, I've presented sales data results about EVALI in November 2020 (more than a year ago) at the Southern Economic Association meetings, and also at last summer's ASHEcon meeting.
To get the full picture, is there any way to estimate the sales via the black market?
is there a website or contact to get in touch with to learn more?
column5: I’d suggest contacting Alex by email. I know he’s advised others.

column2: It was clear in the UK that all three major manufacturers had post-ban brand variants to fill the gap left by menthol cigarettes, flavoured inserts was only one strategy. Are you aware of other post-ban menthol replacement products in Poland?
